title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the total revenue of producing 8 units as $128 and/or does not show the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity=$16×8=$128 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5B99@

The response calculates the total revenue of producing 8 units as $128 and shows the work.

Total Revenue = Price×Quantity=$16×8=$128 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5B99@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the demand curve is elastic for quantities between 8 and 12 units and/or does not explain that the marginal revenue is positive; or use numbers to explain that total revenue is rising as price declines in that quantity range, the percentage change in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

The response states that the demand curve is elastic for quantities between 8 and 12 units and explains that the marginal revenue is positive; or uses numbers to explain that total revenue is rising as price declines in that quantity range, the percentage change in quantity demanded is greater than the percentage change in price, or the absolute value of the price elasticity of demand is greater than 1.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm should keep its price the same and/or does not explain that at a price of $14, the marginal cost is equal to the marginal revenue.
The response states that the firm should keep its price the same and explains that at a price of $14, the marginal cost is equal to the marginal revenue.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that the firm has diminishing marginal returns and/or does not explain that marginal cost is rising at the quantity of 8 units, indicating that the marginal product is falling.
The response states that the firm has diminishing marginal returns and explains that marginal cost is rising at the quantity of 8 units, indicating that the marginal product is falling.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not identify that the allocatively efficient quantity is 16 units and/or does not explain that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve.

The response identifies that the allocatively efficient quantity is 16 units and explains that allocative efficiency is achieved when the marginal cost to producers equals the marginal benefit to consumers, which occurs where the demand curve intersects the marginal cost curve.
